001package io.jstach.jstache;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.Documented;
004import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
005import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
006import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
007import java.lang.annotation.Target;
008
009/**
010 * Tag a method to be used as a mustache lambda section.
011 *
012 * Lambda sections look something like: <pre><code class="language-hbs">
013 * {{#context}}
014 * {{#lambda}}body{{/lambda}}
015 * {{/context}}
016 * </code></pre> Where in the above example a lambda is named "lambda" and optionally has
017 * access to the object called "context" and the raw body passed to the lambda is "body".
018 * A nonexhaustive example of the above lambda in Java assuming the context type is
019 * <code>SomeType</code> <em>might</em> look like:
020 *
021 * <pre><code class="language-java">
022 * &#64;JStacheLambda
023 * &#64;JStacheLambda.Raw
024 * public String lambda(SomeType context, &#64;JStacheLambda.Raw String body) {
025 *     return "Hello" + body "!";
026 * }
027 * </code> </pre>
028 *
029 * The lambda could also return a new model and use the section body as a template instead
030 * of raw content:
031 *
032 * <pre><code class="language-hbs">
033 * {{#context}}
034 * {{#lambda}}{{message}}{{/lambda}}
035 * {{/context}}
036 * </code> </pre> <pre><code class="language-java">
037 * record Model(String message){}
038 *
039 * &#64;JStacheLambda
040 * public Model lambda(SomeType context) {
041 *     return new Model("Hello " + context.name() + "!");
042 * }
043 * </code> </pre>
044 * <p>
045 * JStachio lambdas just like normal method calls do not have to be directly enclosed on
046 * the context objects but can be on implemented interfaces or inherited and thus models
047 * can be "mixed in" with interfaces to achieve sharing of lambdas. However there is
048 * currently no support for static methods to be used as lambdas.
049 * <p>
050 * JStachio lambdas work in basically two modes for <strong>parameters</strong>:
051 * <ol>
052 * <li><strong>Context aware:</strong> The default. The top of the stack is passed if an
053 * argument is present and is not annotated with {@link Raw}.
054 * <li><strong>Raw:</strong> If a string parameter is annoated with {@link Raw} it will be
055 * passed the contents of the lambda section call. <strong>Some caveats:</strong>
056 * <ul>
057 * <li><em>While this mode appears to be the default for the spec it is not for
058 * JStachio.</em></li>
059 * <li><em>The contents may not be valid mustache as the spec does not define that it has
060 * to be.</em></li>
061 * <li><em>If the lambda start tag is standalone the space and newline following the tag
062 * will not be passed to the lambda.</em></li>
063 * </ul>
064 * </ol>
065 * <p>
066 * Similarly JStachio works in two modes for <strong>return types</strong>:
067 * <ol>
068 * <li><strong>Model: </strong> The default. The returned model is pushed onto the context
069 * stack and the contents of the lambda section call are used as an inline template and
070 * rendered against it.
071 * <li><strong>Raw: </strong> If the return type is a {@link String} and the method is
072 * annotated with {@link Raw} the contents of the string are directly written
073 * <em>unescaped</em>.
074 * </ol>
075 * Regardless of parameter and return annotations the method must always be annotated with
076 * this annotation to be discovered.
077 * <p>
078 * Due to the static nature of JStachio, JStachio does not support returning dynamic
079 * templates which is the optional lambda spec default if a {@link String} is returned.
080 * <p>
081 * JStachio is very similar to the
082 * <a href="https://github.com/samskivert/jmustache">JMustache</a> model and does not have
083 * an analog in <a href="https://github.com/spullara/mustache.java">mustache.java</a>.
084 * JStachio currently does not support returning closures of
085 * {@code Function<String,String> } like mustache.java but models can be like
086 * {@code Supplier<String>} for that use case.
087 *
088 * @see Raw
089 * @see JStacheInterfaces
090 * @author agentgt
091 *
092 */
093@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
094@Target(ElementType.METHOD)
095@Documented
096public @interface JStacheLambda {
097
098        /**
099         * The logical name of the lambda. If blank the method name will be used.
100         * @return lambda name
101         */
102        String name() default "";
103
104        /**
105         * Tag a method return type of String or parameter of String to be used as a raw
106         * unprocessed string.
107         * @author agentgt
108         * @see JStacheLambda
109         */
110        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
111        @Target({ ElementType.PARAMETER, ElementType.METHOD })
112        @Documented
113        public @interface Raw {
114
115        }
116
117}
